cho_description:
**UNESCO World Heritage Site**

Crowdsourced photogrammetry of the Palmyra Roman Theatre.

Read this feature blog post to learn more: https://blog.sketchfab.com/cultural-heritage-spotlight-reconstructing-destruction-palmyra-arck/

The Roman Theatre at Palmyra (Arabic: المسرح الروماني بتدمر‎) is a Roman theatre in ancient Palmyra in the Syrian Desert. The unfinished theatre dates back to the second-century CE Severan period.[1] The theatre's remains have since been restored. It used to serve as a venue for the annual Palmyra festival.

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Roman_Theatre_at_Palmyra
